nodes.title: Build wc clone in Rust
nodes.description: Replicate core wc functionality: word count and line count (-l) for regular files. Keep it dependency-minimal. Will later compile to WASM for web UI.

nodes.title: Choose argument parsing approach
nodes.description: Need to decide: use clap/structopt, roll our own minimal parser, or use std::env::args directly. Must balance simplicity vs future extensibility vs WASM compatibility.

nodes.title: WASM target constrains dependency choices
nodes.description: Since we plan to compile to WASM, we need dependencies that support wasm32 target. Clap works with WASM but adds bulk. std::env::args is simplest but may not exist in WASM context. For WASM, args may come from JS anyway.

nodes.title: Use std::env::args for CLI, separate core logic
nodes.description: Decision: Keep argument parsing minimal with std::env::args. Core counting logic will be in a separate module that takes &str or &[u8], making it trivially portable to WASM where input comes from JS FileReader.

nodes.title: Initialize Rust project with cargo
nodes.description: Creating new Rust binary project 'rwc' (rust wc) using cargo init

nodes.title: Rust project initialized successfully
nodes.description: cargo init created Cargo.toml and src/main.rs. Project named 'rwc'. Ready for implementation.

nodes.title: Implement line count feature
nodes.description: Implementing wc -l functionality: count newlines in a file. Will create core counting module and CLI interface using std::env::args.

nodes.title: Structure: lib.rs for core logic, main.rs for CLI
nodes.description: Separating concerns: lib.rs will have count_lines() and count_words() functions that work on &str. main.rs handles file I/O and argument parsing. This makes WASM port trivial - lib functions can be called from JS.

nodes.title: Line count and word count implemented successfully
nodes.description: Both count_lines() and count_words() work correctly. Tests pass (9/9). Output matches real wc for both default and -l modes. Code is clean and WASM-ready with separated lib.rs.

nodes.title: Create PR for rwc line count feature
nodes.description: Committing implementation and creating GitHub PR. This is the first in a stacked PR chain.

nodes.title: PR #1 created successfully
nodes.description: GitHub PR created: https://github.com/notactuallytreyanastasio/deciduous_example/pull/1 - First PR in the stacked chain for rwc implementation.

nodes.title: Compile rwc to WASM
nodes.description: Build the rwc library as a WebAssembly module that can be called from JavaScript. This enables the web UI phase.

nodes.title: Use wasm-bindgen + wasm-pack for WASM build
nodes.description: wasm-bindgen is the standard for Rust-to-JS interop. wasm-pack simplifies the build process and generates npm-compatible packages. Alternatives like stdweb are deprecated.

nodes.title: Add wasm-bindgen and configure Cargo.toml for WASM
nodes.description: Adding wasm-bindgen dependency and configuring crate-type to include cdylib for WASM compilation.

nodes.title: Add wasm-bindgen exports to lib.rs
nodes.description: Adding #[wasm_bindgen] attribute to count_lines and count_words functions to expose them to JavaScript.

nodes.title: Added count_bytes and count_all for complete WASM API
nodes.description: Extended API beyond original wc -l scope: count_bytes() for byte count, count_all() returns WcResult struct with all three counts. Makes web UI more useful.

nodes.title: Build WASM package with wasm-pack
nodes.description: Using wasm-pack build --target web to create WASM package suitable for browser usage with ES modules.

nodes.title: Homebrew Rust lacks wasm32 target
nodes.description: System uses Homebrew-installed Rust, not rustup. Need to either install wasm32 target manually or use rustup. Will check if rustup is available.

nodes.title: Install rustup to get wasm32 target
nodes.description: Homebrew Rust doesn't have wasm32-unknown-unknown. Installing rustup is the standard way to get cross-compilation targets. Will install rustup and add the target.

nodes.title: WASM build successful
nodes.description: wasm-pack build --target web completed. Package at ./pkg/. Had to install rustup and add wasm32-unknown-unknown target first.

nodes.title: Create test HTML to verify WASM in browser
nodes.description: Creating a simple HTML file to test the WASM module in a browser context before building the full web UI.

nodes.title: WASM tests require HTTP server due to ES modules
nodes.description: Browser ES modules require HTTP server to load. Will use Python http.server to test. This is expected behavior for WASM/ES6 modules.

nodes.title: Create PR #2 for WASM support
nodes.description: Committing WASM changes and creating stacked PR #2 based on feature/rwc-line-count

nodes.title: PR #2 created successfully
nodes.description: GitHub PR #2 created: https://github.com/notactuallytreyanastasio/deciduous_example/pull/2 - Stacked on PR #1, adds WASM support.

nodes.title: Pausing for parent repo tooling updates
nodes.description: User is updating deciduous tooling in parent repo. Will improve PR writeup capabilities. Waiting before proceeding to Phase 3 (Web UI).

nodes.title: Upgraded to deciduous 0.2.1 with dot and writeup commands
nodes.description: New features: 'deciduous dot' exports DOT format with PNG support, 'deciduous writeup' generates PR writeups from decision graph nodes. Will use these for Phase 3 PR.

nodes.title: Build Web UI with file upload
nodes.description: Create a web interface that allows users to upload files and see wc-style counts (lines, words, bytes) using the WASM module.

nodes.title: Single-page app with vanilla JS, no framework
nodes.description: Keep it simple: one HTML file with embedded CSS and JS. Uses ES modules to load WASM. FileReader API for file uploads. No build step needed - works directly from file server.

nodes.title: Create index.html with file upload UI
nodes.description: Building the main web interface: file upload area with drag-and-drop support, results display showing lines/words/bytes, clean modern styling.

nodes.title: Web UI created with drag-and-drop file upload
nodes.description: Built index.html with: drag-and-drop upload area, responsive 3-column stats display (lines/words/bytes), wc-style output format, dark theme, error handling, mobile-responsive design. Uses ES modules to load WASM.

nodes.title: Web UI is 100% static - GitHub Pages ready
nodes.description: index.html is self-contained: no build step, no bundler, no server-side code. Just needs to be served alongside ./pkg/ directory. FileReader API processes files client-side. Perfect for GitHub Pages deployment.

nodes.title: Create PR #3 for Web UI
nodes.description: Committing Web UI and creating stacked PR #3 based on feature/rwc-wasm. Using deciduous writeup for PR description.

nodes.title: PR #3 created successfully
nodes.description: GitHub PR #3 created: https://github.com/notactuallytreyanastasio/deciduous_example/pull/4 - Stacked on PR #2, adds Web UI with file upload. Used deciduous writeup for PR description.

nodes.title: Deploy to GitHub Pages
nodes.description: Set up GitHub Pages to host the rwc web UI. Make it accessible at a public URL, running entirely client-side with WASM.

nodes.title: Use GitHub Actions to build WASM and deploy
nodes.description: Strategy: GitHub Actions workflow that builds WASM with wasm-pack, then deploys to GitHub Pages. This ensures pkg/ is always fresh and we don't commit build artifacts to main. Uses actions/deploy-pages for deployment.

nodes.title: Create GitHub Actions workflow for WASM build and deploy
nodes.description: Creating .github/workflows/deploy.yml that: installs Rust and wasm-pack, builds WASM, copies index.html and pkg/ to artifact, deploys to GitHub Pages.

nodes.title: dtolnay/rust-action simplifies Rust setup in Actions
nodes.description: Using dtolnay/rust-action@stable which handles Rust toolchain setup cleanly. Can specify targets directly. Alternative would be actions-rs/toolchain but dtolnay's is more maintained.

nodes.title: Configure GitHub Pages via gh CLI
nodes.description: Enabling GitHub Pages with GitHub Actions as the build source. This allows the workflow to deploy directly without a separate gh-pages branch.

nodes.title: GitHub Pages configured with Actions build
nodes.description: Pages enabled at https://notactuallytreyanastasio.github.io/deciduous_example/ with build_type=workflow. Will deploy automatically when workflow runs on main.

nodes.title: Create PR #4 for GitHub Pages deployment
nodes.description: Committing workflow and creating stacked PR #4 based on feature/rwc-web-ui.

nodes.title: PR #5 created for GitHub Pages deployment
nodes.description: GitHub PR #5 created: https://github.com/notactuallytreyanastasio/deciduous_example/pull/5 - Stacked on PR #4 (Web UI). Adds GitHub Actions workflow for automated WASM build and Pages deployment.

nodes.title: Merging PR chain - preparing for live site
nodes.description: User is merging the stacked PR chain. Once complete, site will be live at https://notactuallytreyanastasio.github.io/deciduous_example/. Next step: comprehensive README showcasing the deciduous workflow.

nodes.title: Create comprehensive README demo
nodes.description: Build a README that serves as a tour of deciduous: showing real decision trees, Claude integration, and the full journey from CLI to web app. Focus on the AI-assisted workflow, with CLI details at the end.

nodes.title: Workflow failed - dtolnay/rust-action not found
nodes.description: The GitHub Action dtolnay/rust-action doesn't exist. Need to use dtolnay/rust-toolchain instead, which is the correct action name.

nodes.title: Fix workflow - use dtolnay/rust-toolchain
nodes.description: Correcting the GitHub Action from dtolnay/rust-action (doesn't exist) to dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable which is the correct action.

nodes.title: Workflow fix pushed - awaiting new deploy
nodes.description: Fixed the action name and pushed to main. GitHub Actions should now run successfully. Waiting for deploy to complete.

nodes.title: Cargo.toml missing WASM config on main
nodes.description: The [lib] crate-type and wasm-bindgen dependencies from PR #2 are missing on main. Need to add them for WASM build to work.

nodes.title: Add missing WASM config to main
nodes.description: Adding wasm-bindgen to Cargo.toml and #[wasm_bindgen] exports to lib.rs to fix the deployment.

nodes.title: WASM config added to main
nodes.description: Added missing wasm-bindgen dependency and exports. Pushed to main, waiting for new deploy.

nodes.title: Write comprehensive README demo
nodes.description: Creating README that tours the deciduous workflow: showing real decision trees, Claude integration focus, and the full rwc journey. CLI reference at the end.

nodes.title: README pushed with full deciduous demo
nodes.description: Comprehensive README added: live demo links, real examples from graph, Claude integration guide, full decision graph PNG, CLI reference. 50 nodes, 57 edges documented.

nodes.title: Project complete - full deciduous demo
nodes.description: Session complete. Built rwc (Rust wc clone) from CLI to WASM to Web UI to GitHub Pages. Full decision graph with 51 nodes, 58 edges. README serves as deciduous tour/demo.

nodes.title: Web UI missing from main - only Hello World placeholder
nodes.description: The full drag-and-drop file upload UI we built in Phase 3 didn't make it to main. Same issue as the missing WASM config - PR merge didn't include all changes.

nodes.title: Fix Web UI on main branch
nodes.description: Restore the full rwc web app with file upload, drag-and-drop, and WASM integration. The current index.html is just a Hello World placeholder.

nodes.title: Restore full Web UI to index.html
nodes.description: Replacing Hello World placeholder with the full rwc web app: drag-and-drop file upload, WASM integration, dark theme, responsive design.

nodes.title: Web UI restored and pushed
nodes.description: Full rwc web app now on main: drag-and-drop upload, WASM integration, dark theme, responsive. Pushed to trigger redeploy.

nodes.title: Web UI live and working
nodes.description: Live site at https://notactuallytreyanastasio.github.io/deciduous_example/ now shows the full rwc web app with file upload and WASM counting.

nodes.title: Update graph-data.json with latest 57 nodes
nodes.description: Syncing latest decision graph to docs/graph-data.json for the live graph viewer.

edges.rationale: Goal requires deciding on argument handling first
This resolves the argument parsing question
Decision on architecture leads to project initialization
After project init, implementing first feature
This action contributes to the main goal
This elaborates on the core logic separation decision
Implementation action led to this outcome
Successful implementation leads to PR creation
WASM compilation is next phase of main goal
Cargo.toml config enables lib.rs WASM exports
While adding WASM exports, extended the API
Observation leads to decision on how to proceed
Test creation reveals HTTP server requirement
Pausing after PR #2 for tooling improvements
Web UI is the final phase of the main goal
Static site observation confirms we're ready for PR
GitHub Pages deployment completes the full project
Workflow creation revealed this tooling choice
After site is live, create demo README
Fix action resulted in new deployment attempt
Deploy still failing, found missing config
README goal leads to writing action
Observation of missing UI leads to fix goal
After confirming site works, update graph data
